title: Alan Moore Collection II (Demos, B-sides and Outtakes)
description:
Warning:
Only for hardcore Alan Moore fans.

Well, here is included some of the early, obscure and/or aborted work by (or inspired by) Mr. Alan Moore.


List of Contents:

- Maxwell The Cat Vols.1-2 (1979-1986)
A comic strip written and DRAWN by Mr. Alan Moore under the pseudonym Jill de Ray (hey, my nickname has the same origin!). The scans aren't very good, 'though.


- Alan Moore's Yuggoth Cultures and Other Growths #1-3.
A collection of brief comic book stories out of print (from early in his career), comic adaptations of poems and long-time aborted projects (including a lost novel and a cancelled horror series with Bryan Talbot). Most of them related to the Cthulhu Mythos or horror genre. Illustrated by Jacen Barrows, Oscar ZÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¡rate, Bryan Talbot and others.


-Alan Moore's The Courtyard. #1-2
It belonged with the last project but ended up as a separate series. An adaptation of an amazing horror short story related to the Cthulhu Mythos.


- Alan Moore's Writing for Comics.
A text piece, published in comic book format with illustrations by Jacen Barrows, of Mr. Alan Moore on the art of writing comics. Warren Ellis says in the back: "It goes right next to Eisner and McCloud on the smart reader's shelf."


- Alan Moore's Magic Words.
Comic book adaptations of some of his songs, poems and prose.


- Alan Moore's Another Suburban Romance.

Comic book adaptation of a performance piece.


-Alan Moore's An Hypotetical Lizard.

Comic book adaptation of a World Fantasy Award winning short story written by Alan.



Thanks to the scanners.



Coming Soon: some ABC collections.
